clinical_study.brief_title: Improved Orthostatic Tolerance = Better Cognitive Function in Parkinson's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Improved Orthostatic Tolerance = Better Cognitive Function in Parkinson's Disease: Does a Successful Treatment of Orthostatic Hypotension Measurably Enhance Attention and Memory Functions in Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Study on orthostatic Hypotension in Parkinson's disease

detailed_description.textblock: Orthostatic hypotension (OH) in Parkinson's disease (PD) may not only be related to dizziness or light headedness but to deficits in attention, visual, and verbal memory. Would a successful treatment of OH which includes physiotherapy significantly improve OH and these cognitive deficits? By means of a randomized cross-over trial, we want to measure and compare the effects of OH therapy on orthostatic tolerance, as well as on attention, visuo-spatial working memory, and verbal memory in patients with PD. If confirmed, therapy of orthostatic hypotension would provide a sound and simple approach to improve those cognitive deficits originating from orthostatic hypotension.

primary_outcome.description: Systolic postural blood pressure drop in the interventional Group (Long_Physiotherapy) less than 10mmHg (5-15mmHg) compared to Short_Physiotherapy

secondary_outcome.description: ≥ 2 points change in Winkler Scale (Sum Score) in Long_Physiotherapy; 10 symptoms must be rated concerning their frequency from 0= never to 4= more than once a day. Sum score from minimum 0 points (no symptoms) to maximum 40 points (all symptoms more than once daily) is interpreted

Epworth Sleepiness Scale ≥ 20% Change of Sum Score in Long_Physiotherapy. Sum Score can range from minimum = 0 Points to Maximum = 24points. More points indicate more symptoms. Cut off for daytime sleepiness are10 points

intervention.description: Ambulatory leg-muscle oriented physiotherapy (2 x 45 minutes per week for at least 8 weeks) at Aachen University Hospital. Daily protocol of leg muscle training, exercises, sufficient fluid intake of 2liter/day, pressure stockings.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Parkinson's patients
- Diagnostis of OH
- able to perform an ambulatory physiotherapy at Aachen University Hospital.
Exclusion Criteria:
- deep brain stimulation or Pacemaker
- severe psychiatric disease
- severe heart disease
- severe vascular encephalopathy
- dementia
- pregnant or lactating women
- extreme pain or immobility
